title: Hint on Scalability
text: Scalability refers to a system's ability to handle a growing amount of work, or its potential to be enlarged to accommodate that growth. In the context of processing data from seismographs worldwide, considering scalability as an important feature means ensuring that the system can efficiently manage increasing data without losing performance.

title: Hint on Scalability Importance
text: Why might it be important for Shameeka's system to be scalable? Consider the initial local versus future global data processing requirements.

title: Scaffold for Scalability
text: Scalability is crucial for Shameeka's system. If you were to ensure the system handles increasing data effectively, what feature should be prioritized?
choices: The system must use heuristic based algorithms
The system must use lossy compression
